data.name: Marble on Rails
data.detailed_description:
'Marble on Rails' is a marble run simulation application.

When you start the application, a sample course begins to play.
In the playback mode, you can change the viewpoint, the marbles to watch, and the number of marbles.

From the menu, you can move to the 'Edit Mode'.

In edit mode, you can create your own courses.

Add mode:
Add rails by pressing the + button. Presets for curves, loops, etc. can be selected.
Del : Delete the last added line etc.
Edit mode:
The rail break points are displayed as spheres.
Click the sphere to start editing. You can change the position, bank angle and Bezier curve control points.
Cam Mode:
Edit up to 4 camera positions for use in playback mode.
Move the camera using the 'Upward', 'Forward', and 'Rotate' checkboxes in the lower left corner and screen drag.

Viewpoint
Control the viewpoint with the 'XY','YZ','XZ','SIDE','Around','Reset' buttons in the lower left corner and the seek bar for zoom.
Press 'XY', 'YZ', and 'SIDE' twice to get the viewpoint from the back side.
The Bezier curve control points move on the visible plane when editing, so proper viewpoint switching is necessary. YZ' or 'SIDE' is recommended.

Connecting to an Elevator
In Add mode, select 'Enter Elevator' to add a straight line connecting your current position to the point of the elevator.
In order to successfully return the ball to the elevator, the rail must be connected to the front of the elevator and the ball must be controlled to roll in the direction of the elevator.
By explicitly connecting to the elevator, you can edit the continuation of the junction point.


Checking the Marble checkbox allows you to run a test Marble.


Differences from the Android version
Compared to the Android version, the accuracy of physics calculation has been increased. This allows Marble to run more smoothly.
data.about_the_game:
'Marble on Rails' is a marble run simulation application.

When you start the application, a sample course begins to play.
In the playback mode, you can change the viewpoint, the marbles to watch, and the number of marbles.

From the menu, you can move to the 'Edit Mode'.

In edit mode, you can create your own courses.

Del : Delete the last added line etc.
Edit mode:
The rail break points are displayed as spheres.
Click the sphere to start editing. You can change the position, bank angle and Bezier curve control points.
Cam Mode:
Edit up to 4 camera positions for use in playback mode.
Move the camera using the 'Upward', 'Forward', and 'Rotate' checkboxes in the lower left corner and screen drag.

Control the viewpoint with the 'XY','YZ','XZ','SIDE','Around','Reset' buttons in the lower left corner and the seek bar for zoom.
Press 'XY', 'YZ', and 'SIDE' twice to get the viewpoint from the back side.
The Bezier curve control points move on the visible plane when editing, so proper viewpoint switching is necessary. YZ' or 'SIDE' is recommended.

Connecting to an Elevator
In Add mode, select 'Enter Elevator' to add a straight line connecting your current position to the point of the elevator.
In order to successfully return the ball to the elevator, the rail must be connected to the front of the elevator and the ball must be controlled to roll in the direction of the elevator.
By explicitly connecting to the elevator, you can edit the continuation of the junction point.


Checking the Marble checkbox allows you to run a test Marble.


Differences from the Android version
Compared to the Android version, the accuracy of physics calculation has been increased. This allows Marble to run more smoothly.
data.short_description: 'Marble on Rails' is a marble run simulation application. You can freely create your own courses. Enjoy the realistic movement of marbles by physics simulation.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 8.1,Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 4160
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4400
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

Minimum:
